alert.note: Alert for Burnet; Llano (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 31 at 9:30PM CDT until September 02 at 7:24PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Burnet and Llano. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 928 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Burnet, Marble Falls, Kingsland, Buchanan Dam, Granite Shoals, Horseshoe Bay, Buchanan Lake Village, Highland Haven, Inks Lake State Park, Bluffton, Longhorn Cavern State Park, Stolz, Tow, Lone Grove, Baby Head and Sunrise Beach Village. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
